Package HW4

Class IniObject

java.lang.Object
HW4.IniObject
public class IniObject
extends java.lang.Object
An IniObject is a sectioned collection of key/value pairs that simply interfaces with .ini files. Specifically this class is meant to work with .ini files and handles key/value mappings of the types supported by these files: string, int, long, double, and boolean. A common use case of this class is to create .ini files from key value pairs, or to simply load and query .ini files - like you might a JSON file.

An .ini file maps entries to values. The entries are of the form "section" or "section:key". IniParser provides geting methods for the values of entries. The get methods throw a runtime IniException if the entry does not exist.

To load a .ini file simply TODO: add loading example

Values can be added or removed from the IniObject using the put and remove methods respectively. For example:

To dump the contents of an IniObject into a .ini file, simply: TODO: add dump example

This class is mutable and not thread safe.

    Creates an IniObject with the entry value mappings of the .ini file iniFile.

  • Constructor Details

    • IniObject

      public IniObject()
      Creates an empty IniObject with no entry value mappings. The class is simply instanitated 
       ini = new IniObject();

    • IniObject

      public IniObject​(java.io.File iniFilePath) throws java.io.IOException
      Creates an IniObject with the entry value mappings of the .ini file iniFile. This class is simply instantiated 
       ini = new IniObject(new File("./config.ini"));
      Parameters:
      iniFilePath - Path to the .ini file you wish to load.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if the iniFilePath is malformed or the wrong extension.

  • Method Details

    • getNthSectionName

      public java.lang.String getNthSectionName​(int n) throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Returns the name of the nth section of the IniObject. Sections are ordered by when they are added to the IniObject by put, or the order they appear in loaded from a .ini file.
      Parameters:
      n - The index of the section in order.
      Returns:
      The nth section's name.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - Throws if there are less than n sections.

    • sections

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> sections()
      Returns a list of the names of the sections in the IniObject.
      Returns:
      A list of the names of the sections in the IniObject.

    • put

      public IniObject put​(java.lang.String section, java.lang.String key, java.lang.Object val) throws IniException
      Puts a section:key to val mapping in the IniObject. Put either overwrites the current value stored at the entry, or creates a new entry and stores the value. Only strings, ints, longs, doubles, and booleans can be added.

      For example, starting from an empty IniObject 

       IniObject ini = new IniObject();
 ini.put("car", "ford", 1);
 ini.put("car", "ford", 2);
      Calling ini.getInt("car", "ford") will return 2.
      Parameters:
      section - The section for val
      key - The key for val
      val - The value to store in the IniObject
      Returns:
      this
      Throws:
      IniException - throws if the type of val is not an allowed type.

    • remove

      public java.lang.Object remove​(java.lang.String section, java.lang.String key)
      Removes the section:key entry from the IniObject if it exists.
      Parameters:
      section - The section of the entry to remove
      key - The key of the entry to remove
      Returns:
      The object at section:key that was removed, or null

    • write

      public java.io.Writer write​(java.io.Writer writer) throws java.io.IOException
      Writes the contents of the IniObject in a loadable ini format.

      For example we can write to the file "out.ini" 

       ini.write(new FileWriter("out.ini"));

      Warning: This method assumes the data structure is acyclical

      Parameters:
      writer - the writer object
      Returns:
      the writer
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an error occurs while writing

    • write

      public java.io.Writer write​(java.io.Writer writer, java.lang.String section) throws java.io.IOException
      Writes the contents of a section of the IniObject in a loadable ini format.

      For example we can write a section of the IniObject like 

       ini.write(new FileWriter("out.ini"), "car")

      Warning: This method assumes the data structure is acyclical

      Parameters:
      writer - the writer object
      section - the section we wish to write
      Returns:
      the writer
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an error occurs while writing

    • writeLines

      public java.io.Writer writeLines​(java.io.Writer writer) throws java.io.IOException
      Writes the contents of the IniObject line by line. This method is commonly used for debugging

      For example we can print the IniObject line by line in stdout like 

       ini.writeLines(new BufferedWriter(new OutputStreamWriter(System.out)));

      Parameters:
      writer - the writer object
      Returns:
      the writer
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an error occurs while writing

    • keysForSection

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> keysForSection​(java.lang.String section)
      Returns an array list of the keys in a given section if the section exists. For example if a section had entries "car:mazda", "car:toyota", "car:ford", then calling keyForSection("car") would return ["mazda", "toyota", "ford"].
      Parameters:
      section - the section whose keys to return
      Returns:
      A list of the keys in a section.

    • getString

      public java.lang.String getString​(java.lang.String section, java.lang.String key) throws java.security.KeyException, java.lang.ClassCastException
      Returns the string stored at the entry "section:key".
      Parameters:
      section - the section of the entry
      key - the key of the entry
      Returns:
      the string value of the entry "section:key".
      Throws:
      java.lang.ClassCastException - if the entry at "section:key" cannot be cast as a string.
      java.security.KeyException - if "section:key" does not exist in the IniObject.

    • getInt

      public int getInt​(java.lang.String section, java.lang.String key) throws java.security.KeyException, java.lang.ClassCastException
      Returns the int stored at the entry "section:key".
      Parameters:
      section - the section of the entry
      key - the key of the entry
      Returns:
      the int value of the entry "section:key".
      Throws:
      java.lang.ClassCastException - if the entry at "section:key" cannot be cast as an int.
      java.security.KeyException - if "section:key" does not exist in the IniObject.

    • getLong

      public long getLong​(java.lang.String section, java.lang.String key) throws java.security.KeyException, java.lang.ClassCastException
      Returns the long stored at the entry "section:key".
      Parameters:
      section - the section of the entry
      key - the key of the entry
      Returns:
      the long value of the entry "section:key".
      Throws:
      java.lang.ClassCastException - if the entry at "section:key" cannot be cast as a long.
      java.security.KeyException - if "section:key" does not exist in the IniObject.

    • getDouble

      public double getDouble​(java.lang.String section, java.lang.String key) throws java.security.KeyException, java.lang.ClassCastException
      Returns the double stored at the entry "section:key".
      Parameters:

      key - the key of the entry
      Returns:
      the double value of the entry "section:key".
      Throws:
      java.lang.ClassCastException - if the entry at "section:key" cannot be cast as a double.
      java.security.KeyException - if "section:key" does not exist in the IniObject.

    • getBoolean

      public boolean getBoolean​(java.lang.String section, java.lang.String key) throws java.security.KeyException, java.lang.ClassCastException
      Returns the boolean stored at the entry "section:key".
      Parameters:
      section - the section of the entry
      key - the key of the entry
      Returns:
      the boolean value of the entry "section:key".
      Throws:
      java.lang.ClassCastException - if the entry at "section:key" cannot be cast as a boolean.
      java.security.KeyException - if "section:key" does not exist in the IniObject.

    • hasEntry

      public boolean hasEntry​(java.lang.String entry)
      Returns true if the entry exists in the IniObject. Entries are of the form "section" or "section:key".
      Parameters:
      entry - The entry to check if exists in the IniObject.
      Returns:
      true if the entry is in the IniObject and false otherwise.
